content.question: Which of the following chords is played?

choices.label: The figure presents stacked whole notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are B2 and F-sharp 3. The treble clef pitches are D-sharp 4 and B4.
The figure presents stacked whole notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are B2 and F3. The treble clef pitches are D4 and B4.
The figure presents stacked whole notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are B2 and F-sharp 3. The treble clef pitches are D4 and B4.
The figure presents stacked whole notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are B2 and F-double sharp 3. The treble clef pitches are D-sharp 4 and B4.

content.answer: The figure presents stacked whole notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are B2 and F-sharp 3. The treble clef pitches are D-sharp 4 and B4.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

topic.text: 3.1: Triad and Chord Qualities (M, m, d, A)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
